alert.note: Alert for Northern Washington; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Washington County through 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartford, or 11 miles northeast of Hudson Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Granville, Hartford, Porter, Fort Ann, Middle Granville, Slateville, Braymer School, Smiths Basin, East Hartford, North Granville, Slyboro, Baldwin Corner, South Granville, South Hartford, Truthville, Raceville, West Pawlet, West Granville and North Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
